page.title: 12Warmingham Craft Workshop
page.content: The Craft Workshop is a converted mill in the centre of the village.Although records show the existence of a mill in 1289 only parts dating to 1780 are left.Olive stones and coconut shells for filler in the plastics industry were ground in modern times until the slump in 1978.In 1979 the workshops and gallery opened in the early days of a trend towards smaller units and traditional crafts. The workshops are used by self employed crafts people such as potters,knitters,artists,farri -ers and a silver smith.The{public gal {-lery}displays resident craftware as well as other craft goods.Light refre- shments can be obtained in the gallery and a short stay tent and caravan fiel -d is opposite the mill.{The Aeroplane {Collection,in}1962 the first voluntary preservation group in the country,re- builds and displays old aircraft.
